definition: to fail to grasp the main points
(negative prefix)/not/no
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
to demand/to request/to coerce
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: You just haven't got it right.
It was a poor performance, full of inconclusive arguments and other commonplaces.
sentences.chinese: 課本不怎麼樣，盡是不得要領的論說和一些老生常談。

sentences.english: All his attempts to unlock the car were futile, because he was using the wrong key.
sentences.chinese: 開車門，但都不得要領，因爲他用錯鑰匙。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, they seem to be missing the point.
sentences.chinese: 遺憾的是，他們似乎不得要領。

sentences.english: So many arguments are so pointless.
sentences.chinese: 因此許多爭執都是不得要領的。

sentences.english: Nice answer though completely misses the point about U. S. troops stationed in North Korea.
sentences.chinese: 答的好，但是對於美軍駐紮朝鮮這一點不得要領。

sentences.english: Your observation is beside the question.
His explanation was not to the purpose.
Besides being vile and stupid, however, the editorial was beside the point.
sentences.chinese: 先不說這位編輯的無禮和愚蠢，他是完全不得要領。

sentences.english: But I think that debate is largely beside the point.
sentences.chinese: 但我認爲，這樣的辯論在很大程度上不得要領。

definition: lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to prevail upon/to coax
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
reluctant to part
to force someone to do something
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
fight to the death/desperate struggle
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
part-time work
authentic
to boast
(idiom) (of a good outcome) unanticipated/serendipitous/fortuitous
